snippet: Carmelo Anthony has rarely taken responsibility for his team’s failures, preferring to shift blame toward injuries, coaches or the playbook. He needs to mature.
abstract: Howard Beck On Pro Basketball column notes that New York Knicks star Carmelo Anthony has rarely taken responsibility for his team's failures, shifting blame toward injuries, coaches or the playbook; argues that the Knicks will never be an elite team until Anthony matures. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: GREENBURGH, N.Y. Alone on a podium late Thursday night, Carmelo Anthony wrapped himself in comfortable catchphrases and verbal deflections. The Miami Heat had not shut him down. He was simply ''missing shots that I normally make.''
